alert.note: Alert for Ballard; Carlisle; Graves; Hickman (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 8:54AM EDT until July 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR MAYFIELD, WINGO, FANCY FARM, BEULAH, DUBLIN, AND SURROUNDING RURAL AREAS... The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Ballard County in western Kentucky... Carlisle County in western Kentucky... Central Graves County in western Kentucky... Northeastern Hickman County in western Kentucky... * Until 100 PM CDT. * At 754 AM CDT, Emergency management reported continued widespread significant flooding across the warned area. Between 6 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and will continue through the morning. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Mayfield, Wingo, Fancy Farm, Beulah, Dublin, and surrounding rural areas. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mayfield, Bardwell, Wickliffe, Fulgham, Sedalia, Wingo, Arlington, Fancy Farm, Lowes and Blandville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
